contents.contents: Walk down the “Rue du petit cimetière de Sainte-Croix” and straight ahead into the “Rue Toussaint Rose” then turn right into the “Rue Valentin Abeille” and then walk into the Garnier garden.

contents.alt: Photo of the entrance to the garden

contents.contents: Garnier, a rich benefactor, donated his house and the gardens to the town in the 19th century. They became a public garden with the statues of great men from Provins.

question.contents: What was the first name of the benefactor?

explanations.contents: Victor Garnier is the benefactor. His statue stands near the library.
